title: Starting a Food Forest on the Cheap!

tasks.task: Starting a food forest on the cheap.
subtasks: Requesting seeds and cuttings from friends on Facebook.
Collecting seeds and cuttings from friends.
Choosing a suitable location for the food forest, considering proximity and permaculture principles.
Planning the layers of the food forest (tall trees, shrubs, vines, ground cover).
Planting pawpaw seeds using cold stratification method.
Ensuring proper planting depth for pawpaw seeds.
Handling and sharing extra seeds and plants with fellow gardeners.
Starting other fruit trees like goji berry, moringa, and hearty orange from cuttings.
Watering and caring for newly planted seeds and cuttings.

tasks.task: Translating the food forest into practice.
subtasks: Preparing the garden area for the food forest.
Introducing diverse plants for a permaculture community.
Paying it forward by sharing seeds and cuttings with others.
